story: “Alex’s phone slips from their pocket in slow motion
moneyMin: landing screen-first in a puddle. The screen goes dark
moneyMax: and no amount of rice is bringing it back to life.”

story: “That nagging toothache finally sends Alex to the dentist
moneyMin: who delivers the bad news with a sympathetic grimace: root canal time. The bill arrives a week later like a painful echo.”

story: “Alex comes home to find half the furniture gone and a note on the counter: ‘Sorry
moneyMin: had to bounce early—family emergency.’ No forwarding address
happinessMin: just empty space and awkward silences.”

story: “The car makes a horrible grinding sound and coasts to a stop. The mechanic’s diagnosis? Transmission failure. Alex’s heart sinks faster than their bank balance.”
“The laptop won’t turn on. Alex tries everything—different outlets
moneyMax: prayers to the tech gods. Nothing. A genius bar appointment confirms it’s dead for good.”

story: “Someone cut through Alex’s bike lock and made off with the ride. All that’s left is a sad piece of cable on the sidewalk and a sinking feeling.”
“A slip on wet stairs sends Alex to urgent care. Nothing’s broken
happinessMin: and the awkward crutch rental add up fast.”

story: “Water starts pooling in the kitchen at 11 PM. By midnight
moneyMax: shaking their head at the burst pipe. By 2 AM
happinessMin: Alex is staring at the invoice in disbelief.”

story: “Alex’s cat gets into something toxic and needs emergency vet care. The night is sleepless
moneyMax: but the bill is absolutely not.”

story: “Two parking tickets appear on the windshield within the same week. Alex swears the signs weren’t clear
moneyMin: but the city doesn’t care about interpretations.”
